scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These twelve letters, 1858-1879, and n.d., pertain chiefly to the family and estate of Philip St. George Cocke. Topics of interest include Belmead, the Civil War, and the University of Virginia. Typed transcripts are available for the majority of these letters.

did.unittitle: Sallie Browne Cocketo John Bowdoin Cocke, Edinburgh, Scotland
Daniel Coleman, Army of the Mississippi, to John Bowdoin Cocke

scopecontent.p: relating news of a great battle near Corinth[presumably Shiloh] and the condition of the troops

did.unittitle: "Aunt F.," South Isle, Charlotte, North Carolina, to Charles Hartwell Cocke

scopecontent.p: mentioning the fall of Vicksburg, news of killed and wounded, and thoughts on the war

did.unittitle: Major Robert B. Taylor, Bremo Recess, to John Bowdoin Cocke

scopecontent.p: expressing gratitude and requesting a loan

did.unittitle: William G. Strange, Dunlora, to John Bowdoin Cocke, at the request of Major William S. Dabney

scopecontent.p: inquiring about Major Douthat's property in Powhatanwhich is advertised for sale

did.unittitle: William Ruffin Coleman Cocke, University of Virginia, to John Bowdoin Cocke

scopecontent.p: concerning financial and management burdens of Belmead. He comments on the need of a "reliable labour-system" and the "abundant evidences that the negro will not furnish the desideratum."

did.unittitle: William H. Richardson, Jr.to Major John Bowdoin Cocke

scopecontent.p: commenting on Cocke's marriage and the reconstruction of the South

did.unittitle: William West Gilmer, Ivy Creek, to Dr. Cary Charles Cocke

scopecontent.p: mentioning Thad[deus Steven]'s bill, apparently concerning the division of land belonging to southern plantation owners among the freedmen, refers to a conversation with his former "slave Ralph now Wormley" concerning voting, and tobacco crop prices. He mentions University of Virginiaprofessors J[ohn] B[arbee] Minor, J[ames] L[awrence] Cabell, and [John] Staige Davis.

did.unittitle: Samuel M. Wilson, Norfolk, Virginia, to John Bowdoin Cocke, Belmead
John Bowdoin Cocke, Belmead, to Cary Charles Cocke

scopecontent.p: re getting tobacco to market and family news

did.unittitle: William Ruffin Coleman Cocke, Richmond, to John Bowdoin Cocke, West View, Goochland County, Virginia

scopecontent.p: concerning a new plan for Belmead
concerning Belmeadand sending Lucy [Cocke]for her education
